# Total Cost for 2
```{python}
#| echo: False
import numpy as np
cad = {
    "flight": 2203.28,
    "ny_hotel": 600.90
}
usd = {
    "boston_hotel": 323.74, 
    "train": 224, 
    "MET": 34
}
```

| Item | CAD | USD |
| ---- | --- | --- |
| Flight ticket | `{python} cad["flight"]` | |
| NY hotel | `{python} cad["ny_hotel"]` | |
| Boston hotel | $\approx$ `{python} np.round(usd["boston_hotel"] * 1.37, 2).item()`  | `{python} usd["boston_hotel"]` |
| train | $\approx$ `{python} np.round(usd["train"] * 1.37, 2).item()`  | `{python} usd["train"]` |
| MET | $\approx$ `{python} np.round(usd["MET"] * 1.37, 2).item()`  | `{python} usd["MET"]` |

Estimated total: `{python} np.round(sum(cad.values()) + 1.37 * sum(usd.values()), 2).item()` $\approx$ `{python} np.round(sum(cad.values()) + 1.37 * sum(usd.values()), 2).item()/2`/person

:::{.callout-note}
Assume $1$ USD $\approx 1.37$ CAD
:::
